intro: Cordia paucidentata var. valenzuelensis, commonly known as the Valenzuelan cordia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its rough, bark-like leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
